Reviews.Title: “The beauty is in its simplicity.”
Reviews.Author: ATLTraveler2
Reviews.Content: This is a cool, funky and chic hotel in a great location. We found this place after wandering around looking for new accommodations for the remainder of our stay in Barcelona. It's across the street from the Chocolate Museum! Stephan and his staff were attentive and welcoming from the moment we walked through the door. Our room was bright, airy and clean with high ceilings and a lovely little balcony with french doors. The bed was comfy and there were no exterior street noises to be concerned with. The common area was great. It had two oversized sofas and a little nook with tables and chairs. There was complimentary, coffee/espresso, tea and bottled water. There was a also a computer for guest use. The only cons we experienced were (1) noise from the hallways bled into the rooms a little more than we have experienced at other establishments and had a bit of an echo effect given the acoustics of the building but a good pair of earplugs solved that problem. (2) there is no printer attached to the computer in the common room. If you wanted to print something out you had to send it to the front desk via email or download it to a flash drive and take it to the front desk. The staff were very happy to accommodate so it really wasn't that big of a deal. With that said these were minor things that did not reflect negatively on our stay. We would definitely recommend this hotel as well as stay here again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Mimm11
Reviews.Content: Booked the XL room for a special occasion for myself and my boyfriend and we were both very excited about staying in the hotel. The website leads you to believe that this is the largest room available and we thought it would be very spacious and the nicest room they had. However, the room was not very big and the quality of everything in the room was poor. It was supposed to have a private balcony, but it had a very small balcony with little stools, not chairs to sit on and it was shared with three other rooms. We noticed that there were some bigger rooms with private balcony's and asked the staff about this, but were told these were XXL rooms and we were not offered these as the booking was made through booking.com and they are only available direct from their website. However, I have since checked the hotels own website and there is no XXL room on there either!!!???? The blind did not work properly on the window – the fabric was torn and the electric mechanism to wind it up and down had broken, so it kept catching in the doors every time you opened and closed them which was annoying. We complained about this, but it wasn’t fixed properly. The LED lights are actually pretty cheap looking and pointless. Our toilet didn't flush properly. The shower leaks water all over the floor. No bathrobes as advertised. We are not fussy travelers at all, as we have backpacked all over the world and stayed in hostels and hotels of all types, and although this hotel was nice, in a lovely building with comfy beds and a great location - I believe if you are charging that amount of money for a room, you need to be able to back it up with quality and fixtures that work and unfortunately this hotel did not (more shabby & basic, than chic & basic). Overall pretty disappointing for the high cost (171 euros per night). Loved Barcelona and would definitely stay in the Born area again, but not in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Is chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicandNice
Reviews.Content: Its nice hotel to stay with your family...clean and the rooms very good..the kids liked it also...

Reviews.Title: “It's got the Waow factor!”
Reviews.Author: Didou_12
Reviews.Content: The few days we spent at Chic and Basic were fantastic as we were met by an incredible friendly and knowledgeable staff. The room and concept of the hotel were funky and made our stay most enjoyable. Simple and yet full of attention to detail. Great location too! Greatly appreciated the staff letting us checking out late and helping recovering a bag stollen as we were leaving. It is a great place to stay at a reasonable rate. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Louisecm
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in August 2011 and really enjoyed it. Location - The hotel was easy to get to from the train station near Las Ramblas - we walked there on a few occasions and this made it very easy. Mind you it is a bit of a walk but we honestly didnt mind and along the way we oftens tumbled across other areas we might not have seen otherwise. The hotel is also close to the beach (walking distance) so some days we walked down there. Ask at the hotel about renting a bike - so easy to bike ride around this area and very fun when you ride down to the beach! Hotel - Loved it! First impression was fantastic, beautiful huge wooden door that you walk through, very interesting lights over every door, gorgeous self serve area - I really wanted to stay somewhere a little different and this definitely delivered on comfort and design. The room was also gorgeous with lights in front of the bed and even a light 'curtain' sectioning off the shower! If you are shy there is also a proper curtain to pull over the shower. I would say though that if you book a twin room and you are not a couple you might not like the bathroom arrangements - its quite open (not a separate room), so just keep that in mind. Service - The service was fantastic. We originally only booked 4 nights but then realised that we arrived a day early and booked a 5th night. However when we had to book the extra ight they only had a smaller room available so we had to book that. However when we arrived the hotel staff were so lovely and said they had upgraded us for the night so that we would not have to change rooms during our stay. They were always very happy to help and knew the area very well. All in all a great stay and would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Basic...”
Reviews.Author: Frudle
Reviews.Content: The good bit: excellent location in a great city. Barcelona. Great staff in reception. The hotel is basic, quirky. And not necessarily inexpensive... Everything is the hotel is sterile, whitewashed. And now worn in most ways. Barcelona has a vast number of similar hotels everywhere. The place is full of tourists all year round.

Reviews.Title: “Lively place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tge_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this boutique hotel. Its location is probably the biggest asset, although our room also met almost every expectation. Good size, clean, facing the (noisy) street, small balcony and good amenities. What strikes me is that when you aim at the somewhat younger traveller with money to spend, this place is very 'basic' in supplying free wifi only in the lounge, and at the same time provide free Nespresso (chic), thea and water. Breakfast is available at very reasonable prices in the adjoining restaurant Kharma (including free wifi). Friendly and helpful staff completed a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lin_Paul18
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel. stayed for a 5 day city break. Love its cool decor comfie bed and HUGE front door..lol. toilet/ shower may be a problem if you are shy but i was with my husband so it wasn't an issue for us. Although it is a little bit out of the way, location wise, i really liked it. Felt more like living with the locals than staying in a hotel on La Rambla.Loved all the narrow little streets and open areas with authentic tapas bars. I would stay again if i was going back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BoscUlrich
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our week-long stay in Barcelona as the last leg in our trip in Spain. From the moment we stepped in we knew it would be a different experience. The staff was very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. The amenities like free coffee, tea, water, cookies, internet access, and gym were great. The room was very neat with the multi-coloured lighting, the strings hanging over the door and the middle-of-the-room shower. It was a good size and had a rack for hanging clothes and drawers. We had a simple breakfast one day at the hotel restaurant, Kharma, and the croissant was very undercooked. The food at dinner was better though. The hotel is in a great location, situated closely to enough restaurants so there is plenty of choice. It is a short walk from the Jaume I subway, La Rambla(don't eat there), close to monuments, and a 15-minute walk from the beaches of Barcelona. Our only complaint was the lack of ventilation in the room. After taking showers in the morning and leaving for the day, the room would be very musky when we returned and we would have to open the door for a while to clear it. Overall, we had a great experience at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again if we come back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alisonandniall
Reviews.Content: From the moment you check in you are treated as special. This is certainly no ordinary hotel. Ultra modern styling sits beautifully next to original features. A goodie bag await you in your room and each floor has a Guest lounge with coffee tea soft drinks and a non rip off drinks machine for extra booze. We really felt that an effort had been made not just to be original but also to be better than its contemporaries. The rooms themselves are beautiful, slightly quirky and very original. They have hidden LED lighting and a remote control which allows you to set the background colour of the room to whatever you please. All the staff are friendly and very helpful and the location in Barcelona's "artistic quarter" El Born, could not be better. Forget worrying about your handbag and paying 12 euro for a glass of sangria on Las Ramblas. The Tranquility of the Born has to be seen to be believed. The hotel also has fantastic bikes to hire at very reasonable rates and the beach is 10min ride away. There are restaurants and bars to suit every pallete within 5min walk of the hotel yet the street is quiet and peaceful. Quite simply the best Hotel I have ever stayed in. Spotlessly clean, superbly located, very well priced I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “well-located cool & funky hotel - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Mcr-traveller13
Reviews.Content: I was slightly worried when I booked this hotel that it might turn out to be just a clever name, but thankfully I was wrong. The concept is very smart - a funky contemporary hotel cleverly inserted into a lovely old 17th century building in a lovely, not-too-touristy old part of central Barcelona. It avoids being cold or sterile like so many 'modern' hotels by its huge sense of playfulness, and actually feels quite cosy. Rooms are small but stylish, clean & bright, with a great sense of fun (soaps & shower gels urging you to steal them! Individually-controlled room mood/disco-lighting! Change the furniture to suit your needs!) The central glass shower cubicle and toilet (or the 'throne', as we came to call it) were unique, and a clever use of space. Our room had a balcony with comfy chairs & tables, albeit with a view of the balconies of the building opposite, but then this is central Barcelona - what else do you expect?! We loved the hotel's comfortable central lounge & wifi area, with excellent free coffee & tea choices, huge modern sofas and chaises longues. Staff were low-key but very friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is great: Born is one of the city's oldest central barrios but has a proper residential community, and the hotel is only a short walk from the Picasso Museum, Parc de Cuitadella and Barceloneta & the seafront. Its also only 15 mins walk from Las Ramblas but is nowhere near as touristy and feels very safe. There are lots of great restaurants, bars, cafes, bakeries, etc, serving the locals as well as non-Barcelonins - in fact we're looking forward to going back to try out some more soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Basic in Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: 30someTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. We had a standard room, which was clean and bright. What will stick the most in my mind about this hotel is the strange decorations in the room. I don't want to be a spoiler in the surprise, let's just call the decor original and leave it at that. The staff is multilingual and friendly. The location is fabulous, steps from the Barrio Gothic, waterfront and the Rambla. Neighborhood is mostly shops and curios, and very safe. No Wi-Fi in rooms, but active in the common rooms for hotel guest. They also provide free coffee, tea, and little snacks. A gym as well, which we did not use because we know the definition of the word VACATION. I should mention that the rooms are bright, but the shower and toilet offer very little privacy because they are surrounded by either glass or midly opaque glass. Sexy yes, but not so much if you're travelling with your Uncle Joe. Windows with french balcony looking onto the street, lovely views for people-watching, but can be a little noisy at night with daily early am garbage collection. Enjoyed our stay, would recommend it to people as a very suitable home-base for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: candym
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 5 nights last November and have nothing bad to say. We have stayed in hotels all over the world and I think this was one of the best. The room was very unique, with a glass shower in the center of the room and rope light strands hanging from the walls that change different colors. We had a little balcony too which was fun to hang out on and have a glass of wine. They have a lounge room with free water and loose leaf teas. Also the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The best part of all was the price. We felt like we had a hip luxury hotel on a budget price. The location was perfect too. Easy walk to the metro or to the beach. Lots of great restaurants close by too. We always felt safe, even really late at night. **On a side note, make sure you keep your wallet in your front pocket while on the subway. When we first got there a couple tried to trick us and take my husbands wallet but he wasn't quick enough and my husband got him in a head lock and got it back! But we heard a lot of stories like this that didn't have happy endings.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with very helpful and friendly staff would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: kay d
Reviews.Content: What a gem this place was. We were there for 4 nights in August '11. Room was spacious although all one room, very funky. Absolutely spotless, air conditioning which was needed when we were there, comfortable beds. The staff were so friendly and very helpful for information. the hotel Karma next door was great for breakfast and all meals the fact we could charge back to our room was great. Great price for a hotel room convenient to everything. If we ever get back to Barcelona this is the place we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JillandJohn012
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 wonderful nights at Chic and Basic after a cruise. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for them. We got a reservation on our last night, at a very good restaurant made by the staff. They ensured we got the terrace area and an English speaking waiter. Fantastic. The location of the hotel is great. Off the main street but very easy walking distance to everything. The rooms are comfortable and funky. Very good value for the money. We has an XL room. Kharma restaurant next door was amazing with fresh tasty food and very reasonably price. The personal service there was exceptional and we were made to feel very welcome

Reviews.Title: “Dark and damp internal room with black mold”
Reviews.Author: karri k
Reviews.Content: Despite this being a stunning hotel at the best location in Barcelona, our bedroom was sadly awful. A fixed illuminated plastic light curtain blocked out the little light we had from an inner courtyard room which meant we needed the lights on all the time. The room also smelt heavily of damp which was due to the shower leaking, some attempt had been made to block a gap with some stuffed tissues but the area was heavily covered by a back mold. I asked to change rooms but was told the hotel was fully booked. The lack of natural light, the damp odour and the presence of black mold made our stay very unpleasant, to compensate for this I was told my comments would be passed to the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Helpful staff. It was also chic...and basic.”
Reviews.Author: Suydam
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay. The hotel was, as advertised, chic and basic. Nothing fancy but very cool looking. Guests from multiple countries, which is fun. There was a huge storm that knocked out our air conditioning and they were helpful letting us know when it would be fixed (18 hours afterward...impressive) and what was wrong. The free coffee, tea and water was nice. The beer/wine vending machine was genius. They have a safe large enough for a laptop bag and you get to keep the key your entire stay. Very helpful. The hotel restaurant had been renamed "Karma." It was good and open late but we never tried any regular meals there. Location is the key. You are an easy walk to the metro, even easier walk to the Plaza del Born and other great places to each and soak up culture. It felt safe (we came home between 12:30a and 2:00a every night without incident). Overall, we would easily recommend this to any other couple seeking accommodation in BCN.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brist0l_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was just great, from the staff who were friendly, welcoming and really helpful, to the funky design and quirky little extras. "Chic and basic" sums the place up perfectly. Don't go expecting 5 star luxury and opulence. That's not what it's about. It is stylish, fun and well equipped though. And in a great location - my boyfriend and I people watched for hours from our balcony. I would recommend that, unless you're intimately acquainted with your room-mate, you don't share. The shower pod in the room is a clever way of fitting all you need into a limited space without further dividing up the lovely, high-ceilinged rooms, but it doesn't make for much privacy. We only stayed for one night, but we will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Marina709
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel because it is something different then the classic town hotels. The changing colors in the rooms and at the room entrance give the "urban" touch. The rooms are "open-space" so if you are shy or travelling with someone who you wouldn't shower with, think twice as only the toilet is separate. But if you are travelling with your partner it is a nice change of the classic hotel concept. The location is very good for exploring as you are a 15-20min walk from Rambla on one side, Barceloneta on the other. Also we LOVED the "Help yourself"-area - Nespresso coffee, Muffins etc. every morning and through the day. One minor objection - the rooms don't have a closet only a "hanger" so expect that your clothes might spend the holiday in the bags. Would recommend the hotel if you are young and on a City-Trip holiday :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Forsyte
Reviews.Content: Booked my room last minute on the hotels own website and got a great discount. WHAT I LIKED: good location (10 minutes to the Ramblas, around the corner from the Picasso museum) nice design room free water, wlan, fruits etc … in the lounge area the lounge area free gym friendly staff great value WHAT I DID NOT LIKE: no safes in the rooms, too little and too smal safes at the reception No WLAN in the rooms The window opens to the street and it was a tad too noisy The hotel has aged, need to refurbish it, paint rooms, renew stuff Everywhere there was the crappy smell of chemical disinfectant - use organic citrus based cleansing solutions instead

Reviews.Title: “Cool idea..... shame about the reality!!”
Reviews.Author: bigted21
Reviews.Content: Hardly know where to start! I've read the other reviews again and I think I must have been in a different place! Just back from 3 nights in Chic & Basic - or should it be Tacky & Neglected?? There are some positives - fantastic location in the Born area of Barcelona which has lots of great bars, restaurants and shops very close by. Also fairly close to a metro station which makes getting around really easy. The staff on reception were friendly and welcoming and the bed was comfortable. Great free coffee and water plus muffins for breakfast (the bar and restaurant were closed). Basically, the idea is great - obviously trying to be different to other hotels which has to be applauded. Unfortunately, the reality is quite different. If you like lovely old buildings you'll be mortified by the quality of finish here - it's just awful! The room we stayed in was tatty and not particularly clean. We had doors out onto an outdoor area wouldn't even close never mind lock!! The room was painted white and is dirty and marked - really needs a coat of paint. Skirting boards which are dusty and not attached properly. The shower (though cool in design) has serious drainage problems - everytime we used it there was a foul smell of rancid water!! Because the room and bathroom is all 'open' it meant that the whole bedroom reeked everytime we had a wash!!! Hardly chic! The corridor floors and the walls (covered in plastic or glass) are obviously not original so our room was VERY noisy. We were woken up every time anyone walked past so hardly slept in 3 nights - not helped by the fact that they play irritating music in the corridors until late at night and we had a speaker just outside our room. This is the longest review I've ever written but this place just looks like an amateur has had a go at transforming an old building into something chic and different - some hotels do a great job of this but this place is not one of them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Monica4485
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Very convenient location. Room was quite nice, only a bit noisy and the pillows were too small (but that's personal) and not comfortable, so we asked for some extra pillows after the first night. We loved the Nespresso, cookies and bottled water. (complimentary)

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cathsun
Reviews.Content: Very funky, colourful, clean and comfortable hotel. Good location, 5 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station, and about 10 minutes walk to the infamous La Rambla. Good hotel service. Great chill-out zone with internet, wifi and help-yourself zone with coffee, tea and snacks. Very comfortable bed, you'd struggle to get up every morning. No wifi access from the room, would be great and more convenient if we can access wifi from the room though.

Reviews.Title: “Supercool hotel with great amenities and location.”
Reviews.Author: yawadrah
Reviews.Content: I traveled there with 3 adults and one 18 year old. we all loved the hotel. The location is really great. It was nice to have internet and coffee/tea/cookies available 24 hours a day. The staff was friendly and helpful. The interior design is really neat and modern, our teenager was VERY impressed. The shower is full glass and only separated from the room by a pull-curtain-this caused us no problems, and could be very romantic. Both our rooms had a balcony with huge french doors. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in the perfect city to celebrate a 30th birthday - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: chippylady
Reviews.Content: In just a few words it would be difficult to explain how good our experience of the Chic and Basic hotel and Barcelona was but we will give it a go. The rooms are very comfortable and a little quirky - the umpteen mood lighting settings really allow you to relax whatever the mood! The Help yourself facilities are more than adequate, the abundance of comfortable seating not only allows you to sit, drink and read in peace but also gives you the chance to meet other hotel residents for a chat and catch up on experiences. Location great for touring Barcelona - a must visit are the arabian baths located behind the hotel, only a two minute walk. Lots of great bars and restaurants within walking distance, not to mention the beach!!!! Would like to thank Gustavo Gomes for arranging Barcelona FC tickets for us, a truly great experience - overall a great stay and will definately be returning in the not too distant future. Steve & Emma

Reviews.Title: “Great central base to explore the city!”
Reviews.Author: MBStravels
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, but the hotel is definitely deserving of it! Chic and Basic is in a great location to explore the city. Lots of restaurants, shops and stores around the hotel. Easily able to walk to La Ramblas, the harbor or the beach in approximately 20 mins. We found it nice to be slightly away from the noise and crowded La Ramblas, but still close enough to walk when we wanted to be there. Our room was clean and had a modern edge. The bed was actually comfortable! We had a great balcony that was nice to sit out on with a glass of wine. There is a lounge area with free bottled water, coffee, tea, cookies and internet. The staff were warm and helpful and were able to suggest restaurants, assist with public transit and directions to the sights. The only point I'd raise is the showers... they are completely glass and right beside the bed. There is a 'curtain' that you call pull across, however, if you are shy or with someone you do not know well this might be important for you to know :) If you are looking for a convenient, clean and trendy place to stay, with helpful staff and a good rate I'd recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Pretty”
Reviews.Author: anqqa
Reviews.Content: First impression was good right after the first sight of the front door and continued throughout the stay, with very cheerful, helpful and friendly staff, lighted corridors of pure fun! Cozy lounge with tea, coffee, water and internet free of charge, cute little gym with more free water and towels, very nice chillaxing rooms with custom changing color schemes! Excellent mixture of old and new, very beautiful all in all. On the other hand the room with balcony was a quite noisy during the night which interrupted good night's sleep somewhat, I'd still vote for the balcony though. Good location next to relaxing park Ciutadella, near excellent restaurants as Barcelona is full of them. The distance to nearest metro station a few hundred meters so not right next to one but really doesn't matter in a city planned for walking anyway :)

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Basic Born Barcelona - a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: agoldthorpe1972
Reviews.Content: In Barcelona for work I wanted to avoid the usual 'business hotels' so for the same price as the usual 4 star places I found the Chic & Basic Born (I first noticed them in Amsterdam). It's a great concept chain; trendy rooms, simply furnished in white and with casual communal areas where you can help yourself to drinks. Whilst missing breakfast, let's be honest, there are not that many great hotel breakfasts to write home about. The hotel is in a fabulous location by the Born. it's a fashionable but 'real' neighbourhood that is great for bars, small independent shops and amazing Tapas places. And there isn't a Starbucks, McDonalds or KFC in sight! And that is always a good thing. The rooms have great beds, I went for room 25 with it's own little balcony and also 10 steps from the communal areas - good for coffee on a morning. If you're travelling with someone you don't know well you will soon... the rooms are open plan so you can see the shower from the bed (and hear the toilet) so there's no point staying here if you're shy. With the local area, the cool rooms and good price i would definitely recommend you to stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_S_2010
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a unique hotel in the best part of Barcelona then Chic & Basic is the place for you. The hotel is a fab mix of historic Barca architecture and quirky modern touches. We stayed last weekend and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Check in was a breeze and we were able to keep our room on for a few extra hours at no cost. There are some really nice touches like the welcome pack, free tea/coffee/water and internet. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a central base to explore the city, there are loads of great restaurants and bars within walking distance - and good transport links if you want to venture a little further afield. We'll definitely be back! Soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ErinandTony
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. It is in a fantastic location and the building is absolutely beautiful. There is a lounge (very modern and sleek) with free wi-fi, a computer, free bottled water, free coffee (a Nespresso machine) and free loose leaf tea. The rooms are gorgeous with different colored mood lighting that you can change and it ranges the colors of the rainbow. Also, the rooms are very quiet and the beds are super comfortable. The rooms are also huge which is rare in a city like Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic.........or Erotic?”
Reviews.Author: Mick8109
Reviews.Content: Both I think. Although I'd say more to the Erotic. This hotel is certainly unusual and if architecture is an interest Chic & Basic Born is worth a visit just to look round the inside. The white walls, the chrome, high ceilings, mood lighting and of course... that shower! What do I have say about a hotel room where the glass shower not only forms a crude room divider it's also big enough to party in. In my book four people in shower is a perfectly aceptable number. Eh, mixed of course. And if you're a bit of a wozz then you can pull the drapes across to cover your modesty. If I have any complaints it would be that guests should have a member of staff show the way through the labyrinth of mood lighting and glass bead curtains to their room, then explain all the technology. It took a couple anxious hours to work out that no, it was not hotel policy to shower and use the toilet with the residents of the building opposite looking on and being close enough to shout encouragement. How were we to know that there was a hidden electric blind covering the balcony doors! We had a room at the rear of the hotel which gave us a loverly peaceful balcony. The Born area is terriffic for eating out. You'd have to stay for months to exhaust all of the small restaurants and walking out and about in the evening is just a joy. Look down any small ally way and there you will find an eating place. And it appears Barcelona has finally got to grips with the pickpockets at least in the Born area. The only time we saw any evidence of the problem was a group of young girls working the fountain in the park, as seen on Utube, are still there. In fact I have to own up to not noticing I'd dropped a credit card whilst walking near La Ramblas until a chap picked it up and returned it to me! The real people of Barcelona. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A true brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: J-Morten
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chic and Basic Born Hotel for 4 nights, and thought I hit the jackpot in the hotel lottery of Barcelona (I always find it difficult to choose hotel in large cities I've never been to...). I chose this hotel based on reviews posted on other sites than TA. Location: Nearby the Parc de la Ciutadella in the Born area. I found the location to be in perfect distance from everything. We went over to las Ramblas one night, but thought that was just a mess. The narrow streets with all the small shops and galleries were so much more charming than the main drag. We walked to the beach in about 25 minutes and la Sagrada Familia in about 30 minutes. But Metro stops were not far away either. Staff: All the staff we encountered were friendly, smiling and greated us. I had my birthday while staying there, and got congratulated by the friendly girl in the reception. The receptionists were all helpful with taxi, map guiding etc. Common area: Coffee and water is free, and a nice common area where you could read or use the computer. Wifi worked fine in our room. In front of every room you had curtains that reflected the different colored LED lights in the ceiing in front of your door. Rooms: Decent size and I really liked the feature where you could change the light. Not very useful, but fun. Shower in the middle of the room didn't bother me. I liked the "welcome pack" with the guide book etc. Nice touch. The bed was large and comfy. Cleanliness: could improve a little here, but not at all bad. the White bar: Made fantastic Mojitos and also had a lovely breakfast. All in all a place I would book again without doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy place, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 3voyager
Reviews.Content: The name is very true the hotel was really chic and basic, loved it for the design the location ,the rooms. Only complain is that the restaurant was closed the first days of our stay so we had to go across the street for breakfast and when they opened and when they opened they weren't realy ready.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Pinky88Toronto
Reviews.Content: We were referred to the Chic & Basic hotel by a friend who'd lived in Barcelona, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very well located - we only took cabs to go to the airport - everywhere else we walked or took public transit - it's close to metro and hop on/hop off tours, etc. The area is full of great shops, restaurants, etc, and isn't smack dab in the middle of the tourist traps. Before we arrived, we booked online and I emailed the hotel with a couple questions - they always responded promptly and graciously. We paid about 110 euros a night. When we arrived, we were greeted in a friendly and welcoming way - and upgraded to an extra large room! The fellow at reception was friendly, spoke English, and showed us some key areas on the map. All the folks we encountered at reception were pleasant and great to deal with. Our room was great - very stylish, clean, and fun with the changeable lights. Comfy bed, great shower, self controlled AC. We loved it. Our room faced the street and we didn't find it noisy... not even when Spain won in the semi-finals! The only possible downside would be that the wireless connection is weak in the rooms, so to use our mobile devices we had to go to the common lounge area. This was very close to our room and stocked free water, coffee and snacks! The only way this would be difficult is if we had to do work...which we didn't. We were just checking emails etc. so were happy to sit in the lovely and comfy lounge. We'd recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendelicious”
Reviews.Author: cjdv
Reviews.Content: Tiny but marvelously designed rooms; good service; excellent location across from Barri Gothic; mad hipster vibe if you dig that. Super clean; great value. Charming small balcony overlooking street. Champagne and rose petals waiting in the room for us when I let them know we were there on honeymoon too - very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, convenient location, comfortable hotel with some stylish/tacky touches”
Reviews.Author: PrincessBaby
Reviews.Content: The rooms have everything you need for a short stay. The beds are large and comfortable. The shower is powerful and there is plenty of space to unpack. There was not a lot of noise at night. Yes, the decor is a little tacky/chic stylish depending on your point of view. We found it silly but quite fun. Hotel staff were very attentive- printing off airport bus timetables and giving us advice and directions. The communal lounge area is a nice touch- having free bottled water, nice coffee (and fruit and pastries in the morning) is useful. Hotel is located in a trendy district away from main tourist areas, but with plenty of nice restaurants, cafes and bars and little squares you can sit outside in. Close to a metro stop, and walkable to historic centre and seafront.

Reviews.Title: “oasis in the chaos of a volcano”
Reviews.Author: jgd
Reviews.Content: fun & fabulous is how i sum up chic & basic. great location. excellent staff, most especially the manager from austria! nothing too much trouble, always happy to see you and absolutely efficient. room was stylish and fun a perfect spot to be stranded while the ash clouds cleared and air travel disintegrated! we had a cute little balcony where we enjoyed lot's of chilled cava! oh, and the other excellent extra was free unlimited (delicious) coffee & bottled water. the staff here make the difference. go & enjoy! i'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Smashing!”
Reviews.Author: Spoogsie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, located near all the 'Hot Spots'. Very modern and 'posh' without being overpriced. Excellent concept. Hope to come back in a rather soon future

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to feel like a local”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneFoodLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during a two month trip in Spain. Very friendly and helpful staff, nothing too much trouble. Situated in Born, which is far enough away from the drunken tourist drinking jugs of cheap Sangria to actually get to know how a local lives in Barcelona. Will definitley go back next time we are in Barcelona. Don't miss Taverna del Born on Passeig del born for coffee, beer and tapas. This hotel is perfectly located to eat in some great restaurants within walking distance. The free coffee and water in the common area is just a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: Antwerp2Dutch
Reviews.Content: This is a highly recommended hotel for a romantic get away in Barcelona. A certain amount of open mindedness may be required to deal with the exposed shower in the middle of the room, but once you get used to the idea it's also part of the fun. Otherwise we're full of compliments to the always helpful people at the reception, the comfortable bed, plus other perks like internet, a coffee machine and water bottles. And you really have to hand it to whoever designed the place- clearly a lot of thought had been put into the intriguing architecture and decor of the place. We were upgraded to the large room so it was quite spacious, though we don't know about the other types of room. The location is good- Born seems like an up and coming area, and besides it's really not far from the tourist sights. In short- we liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Just plain ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: AndyAuckand
Reviews.Content: Situated is reasonable but a fair walk from Rambles. Plenty of restaurants and things to do. Room was standard and the shower was at end of bed. When you got out of shower it was onto a step - sideways then down. If you wear glasses you are in danger zone here. All bathroom & toilet area done out in mirrors and tiny. Room very dark with glass bead curtains and coloured lights. We moved rooms to get a safer bathroom and we did - paid big bikkies - it was painted black and lighting dim. Impossible for make up. Stairwell down to foyer had no hand rails. We took lift. Possibly the worst hotel we have every stayed in - have travelled extensively

Reviews.Title: “It`s basic, but I don`t know about chic.”
Reviews.Author: linksmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Very nice and helpful young people at the front desk. We had two rooms on the first floor, but the elevator did not stop there - only from the second floor and up - so we had to drag our luggagge up a stair. They offered to help us if we needed, but we are healthy people so we carried it by ourself. Rooms are very minimalistic and white, and to me they had a rather "cold" expression. The shower is a glasstower in the middle of the room. The shower itself is fixed and can`t be taken off and handheld, makes it difficult for example to wash your hair. I hate that in hotels. Coffebar next door and small restaurant right across the street. Lots of other places nearby. There is really nothing wrong with this hotel, so I cannot say I would not recommend it, but it was simply not my kind of place. That`s all.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Barcelona design hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sweethomesaway
Reviews.Content: Don't expect luxurious amenities, but do expect friendly service (they tried for weeks before we arrived to book a reservation for us at a popular restaurant), funky decor and the best location in the Born district. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location simply chic”
Reviews.Author: DiegoMarc
Reviews.Content: I visted this hotel last week to find out what the fuss was about , I have to say the place has a great vibe to it, like another review said it could use a bit of paint, but the common areas are amazing. The guy at the front desk was cool but the resto/bar will be closed for renovations so keep that in mind if you plan on comming to Barcelona in the next few weeks. -David Naveira www.pulsobcn.wordpress.com

Reviews.Title: “Cool and fun”
Reviews.Author: NJgirlonthego
Reviews.Content: I like how they tooks this old building and kept the cool old feature and made the rest modern. The rooms are very pretty. We were in the back of the hotel and had a small balconey. It was quieter there. My sister had a room on the street and it was a little noiser. It's very close to the Picasso Museum. I'd stay again. There was a computer available in the coffee room for free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: exitrowplease
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really unique; cool old building w/lots of character, modern amenities and decor, good location. Our room faced the street and we had a nice small balcony w/large shuttered doors. It was a little loud when the doors were open, but quiet and peaceful when the doors were closed and the light blocking shade was down. There was no sitting area, and it was a little on the small side, but perfect for us. Large modern shower & hair dryer, no ice machine, loved the complimentary bottled water and coffee/espresso machine. The service was good, they were very helpful if you asked for advice. The location was great for us, it was near a lot of neat restaurants and shops, near sights, and within walking distance of everything we wanted. They had a hip restaurant that was attached, it had a trendy vibe, and we though the downstairs was going to be like a lounge but when we went down there it was really bright and akward.

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all… Chic & Basic”
Reviews.Author: vipdot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful. I loved the decor and the room was lovely but there are a few things I didn't like: there is no room to put suitcases and no closet (there is a place with two hangers) and the whole interior needs a coat of paint. Everything is white so it is easy to see that in 5 years it hasn't had TLC. The bathroom is integrated to the room and the shower has no place to put shampoo, soap, you get the idea. The common area is fantastic, I loved the couches, the free tea, coffee and wireless internet. The location is ideal, close to the Picasso Museum and the "Barrio Gótico", restaurants and nightlife abound. I recommend it for travelers with only a little luggage. The personnel was fantastic very helpful and nice. Ask for a room not facing the street as it is noisy at night, it is Spain after all…

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Andyjay123
Reviews.Content: Cannot tell you how good the location is within spitting distance of everything including the beach. hotel does what it says on the tin i loved the chill out room with very large sofas and internet. only downside if you can call it one is that the floors in the hallway are hard so you hear people walking sometimes but thats just me being anal staff are great fun, young and up for helping out. enjoy andy

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: VikingVagabond
Reviews.Content: The Chic & Basic Born has a perfect location in the middle of the trendy El Born district of Barcelona, 10 minutes walk to the Cathedral. The hotel is a very trendy place with very trendy people, so people watching here is great fun! Rooms are indeed special..... Our room was all white, with a LED lightning system so you are able to change the light/ mood of the room into various colours. Great fun for 10 minutes, but then you think the whole idea is kind of stupid... :) There is no separate bathroom, and the shower is a glass installation in the middle of the room. I went there with my partner, but going there with my mum would be a quite different story...! The room was also quite small, with little room for suitcases, and almost no floor space. A special hotel experience, but on my next visit I would prefer to stay in one of the other design hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: StopForDirections
Reviews.Content: I'm not giving this hotel a top review because the rooms really could use some maintenance. Almost everything in the room is white, which means that it looks dirty if it's not maintained. Our room could have used a good paint job and a major cleaning. The dust skirt on the bed was covered in stains. The hotel was however well priced and comfortable with free water, coffee and use of the computer which was good. It's also very central. If this hotel makes a few small changes, it would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ramsden
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. It's beautiful - we were both blown away by the design of the place. We got a free upgrade to an extra large room which was much appreciated and it was a joy to stay there. We loved the free coffee/tea/water facilities, the bed was super comfortable and it was just a real treat. The hotel was presented with a real charm by the materials in the room. It's located in a great part of town, about 10 mins from the Ramblas and in a lovely area all of its own. You can also rent bikes from the hotel at Euro 11 per day which is a BARGAIN - we had a great day out on them! I've already recommended this place to a friend and will continue to do so - we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “True to its NAME”
Reviews.Author: angeManila
Reviews.Content: It is one of those trendy hotels suited for those who love to experience something new. The room was well designed, very chick and minimalist furniture. The hallway and the architecture feel like you are in a disco hotel. There was a very cute receptionist and very accommodating. The room is a little small.I do not recommend it for those people with alot of luggage. If you want space and more private, I truly recommend the apartment type. The apartment has a very good location, close to all the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Unique & Funky Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Silverpink25
Reviews.Content: This unusual hotel in my favorite area of Barcelona definitely sticks to it's principles of "chic" and "basic". I'm sure anyone reading this now has already gathered from previous reviews and pictures that this hotel has a crazy colored light thing going on. Other than that, everything else is starkly white, giving the room a super-modern, clean and sleek feel. The lights are fun and the premise is interesting, but I have to say that it did slightly lose it's appeal as our stay went on. I really don't have many negative things to say about our stay, however. The hotel's basic policy seems to be that rather than have the staff serve you, you should already have pretty much everything you need. This was true for the most part, although it does lend to kind of an impersonal experience. We fully utilized the "help yourself" room which comes equipped with free water, coffee and tea, as well as a little loungey area and a computer hooked up with free internet. There's also a little vending machine stocked with juice, beer, snacks, etc. for a reasonable price. The location was great - right in between the historic area of the Born district and the park. Born is packed with cute cafes and shops, so we had a lot of fun just browsing around the area. We had a street-facing room which opened to a small balcony. I don't usually mind background traffic noise (living in NYC), but there was some construction going on while we there that tended to be extremely loud. I'm pretty sure they were even doing some work out there in the middle of the night one night, which did not make for a good night's sleep. The bed was super comfy, though, so I guess that made up for it to an extent. In summary, I would recommend this hotel to a younger crowd looking for a funky, unique hotel experience. My husband and I were actually on our honeymoon, and it was perfect for this kind of trip. I probably would not want to stay more than a few nights though.

Reviews.Title: “A multicolor night...”
Reviews.Author: SushiMambo
Reviews.Content: The C&B is a very nice Boutique hotel with a good relation Quality\prize. Rooms are quiet ,original and totally white with the possibility to choice the colour of the lights and so the color of the room! There was only one fault: no bar in the room... but out in the floor and that's not the best in an hotel like this one. Costumare care is well prepared and nice. The hotel is in the center of the city and near the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: DanPL
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Its name tells it all: “basic” but “chic”. Anyway, I specially agree with the "chic" part.

Reviews.Title: “Old People Will Love It Too”
Reviews.Author: SNumber6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for 3 days after a transatlantic cruise back last March and picked Chic and Basic Born mainly for location ... but also because all we read told us that it fit the artsy eclectic city that Barcelona is ... We were not disappointed in the least ... Perfect location for the turistic tours ... a lovely park nearby ... nice restaurants and nightlife close by ... and the Chocolate Museum ... across the street just for my wife ... Rooms were clean and comfortable and ... interesting with the inroom shower beads and lights ... walking down the halls was a bit like a San Francisco hippie commune from the 60's ... but what the heck we were young then ... The internet was always available ... the staff helpful and courteous ... The only drawback was the lack of anything on TV in English to fall asleep to ... so we rented movies ... I'm writing this now since my son is spending a week there now ... and it brought back these great memories ...

Reviews.Title: “No chairs, no desk, no lights, no closet - but a loo in the middle of the room!”
Reviews.Author: Cara007
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel for those of you who prefer lighted curtains instead of a desk to work at. Also the perfect place to stay if you prefer your loo in the center of the room, don't need wireless internet (just not working), prefer rooms that are really hot in the middle of the summer despite "air-conditioning", prefer to leave your clothes on the floor because there is not a closet and not even a chair in the room. Also excellent for non-smokers who think it is a really good idea to provide an ashtray in the non-smoking rooms. A perfect place to relax away from books, because there is simply not enough decent lightning to enable you to read anything. Hotel staff is sometimes not even present at the front desk - maybe they are busy writing all the inexplicably positive reviews about this "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Funky and Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: OrcaMoon
Reviews.Content: After a long day of traveling, the Chic & Basic hotel was anything but basic. The friendly hotel clerk told me I had been upgraded to a larger-sized room. Pushing aside the rope lights from the door, I dropped my backpack in awe. I had been given a flat to stay in, complete with an enormous bed, a full-sized shower, and a balcony with a lounge. A small guidebook to the room explained how to arrange the pieces of furniture to suit your needs. Immediately, I set up the lap table and wireless keyboard to check my emails in bed using the flat screen TV. In-room internet plus a movie cost me 9 Euros, but I got complementary bottled water, lollipops, and shower gel. The shared lounge area had a computer with free internet, along with coffee and tea. There was also a vending machine stocked with snacks, juice, small liquor bottles, and sparkling wine! My only regret is that I only spent one night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & basic”
Reviews.Author: Nebrink
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be named CHEAP & Basic or perhaps CHEAP & Nasty. Everything about the hotel is CHEAP and it looks more like a brothel with red lighted curtains in your room and a shower and toilet just in the middle of th small room allowing absolutely no privacy what so ever. The hotel does not provide any of the basic needs that a hotel guest might ask for such as a good confortable bed, a private loo, somewhere to put your clothes, a safe for your lap-top, working air-conditioning or quiet surroundings at night. Avoid this hotel at any cost!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with nice facilities”
Reviews.Author: dstivescpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a cruise. The location was a pleasant surprise in a very lively and fun area of Barcelona. Great restaurants all around and within walking distance to the center of the city which is crowded and not where you want to be late at night. The area around this hotel is much less intimidating. The Picasso Museum is 2 blocks away. The rooms are small but cleverly decorated with the shower in the middle of the room. Front desk was very helpful and perfect English was spoken. The hotel is in a renovated, historic and beautiful buidling. This is not a typical chain hotel. It is just the opposite with some clever extras and tongue in cheek signs. Try it.......you will enjoy your stay. We paid under US$200 which is a bargain today in a European city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: whinamillaco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through Expedia.com for our Honeymoon in April of this year and absolutely LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT! As well as an excellent price in a wonderful neighborhood (with the metro, like others said, only being a few minutes walk), this hotel was absolutely ROMANTIC! I loved the lighting and the interactive TV with its choice of music. The shower in the middle of the room was also very unique and romantic. The room, although it could be considered small by most American standards, was plenty large enough for a cozy weeklong stay. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was simple by nice. Our room was located at the back of the hotel, so it was away from street noises (which I'm sure were minimal anyway) but it did face an apartment complex that was undergoing construction (which, of course, I can't hold the hotel accountable for.) If you are a light sleeper, or enjoy sleeping until the afternoon, you might want to invest in earplugs. The room was outfitted with a thermastat (which we didn't notice until the third day; it was hidden behind the LED curtains) but we didn't have need for it. We opened the doors to our balcony and it was plenty cool in the room. The welcome package was an adorable extra, with cute soap and shampoo and candy! Also, we stayed in a room that was located next to one of the communal areas, so we were able to pick up the free wifi in our room, which was an added bonus. The free water and espresso was also very nice, considering we would often not venture out of the room until noon and needed some quick caffeine. The staff was not anything but friendly and helpful, offering us a safe to store my laptop in during the day. The hotel also has a bar/small restaurant located downstairs, which was very 'chic' as the name states, though slightly expensive (we ordered gin & tonics which were 11 Euro each! However, they were rather large drinks - this also taught us the lesson on how to ask how much things are.) Overall, it was a wonderful experience and I will most definitely want to revisit Spain and the Chic and Basic Born!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated, but might stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: SusanH37
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. The first time was in Sept. 2007. We planned a quick, 4-day trip in Barcelona, and decided to stay here again, as our last stay in this hotel was only for one night. When I arrived around noon, I asked in Spanish if the clerk spoke English. My boyfriend and I speak as much Spanish as we can (no matter how poorly) when we travel to Spain. She actually rolled her eyes at me and said impatiently, in English, yes, of course. It was a bad start. It certainly didn't make me feel very welcome. I found out that the room wouldn't be ready for a while, so I wandered out. When I returned, it was the same clerk, but somehow, she had transformed into a very friendly and helpful person. I was glad. She did a lot for me in as far as continually checking with the maids and trying to make sure I got the first clean room available. She was so helpful that I forgot about my greeting. The room itself was as nice as before. It was clean. I love the design. We both love the shower in the middle of the room. I don't mind the lack of space in the room either. There is no proper closet, but there is a small area with a little bar with hangers on which to hang your clothes. The hotel is in our favorite area of Barcelona--the Born district. In our opinion, it has the best bars, restaurants and shopping. I love that area. The Metro is about a 5 to 10 minute walk from the hotel, which is nice. We would get home late and take advantage of sitting on the tiny balcony, which was particularly good for people watching. One reason I wouldn't stay here again is that the bathroom/toilet room isn't very private. It's glass, with a partial smoky glass area for privacy, but the door has an open space at the top, and in addition, our door didn't close completely. The only other complaint I have, but it's tiny, is that the maids walked in on us, even though we were yelling, in Spanish, "please come back later." We thought it was weird that they walked in because hall noise was visible from the room--another minor complaint. Those are the only complaints. If you wouldn't be bothered by what I mentioned, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lives Up to its Name”
Reviews.Author: doronfl
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very modern, trendy design. Clear plastic enclosed shower in the middle of the room is cool. Kind of small room, not much space to spread stuff out. Lounge area with comfortable couches, small fridge with water, plus tea pot and high end espresso machine. Computer with internet available as well. The rooms are not soundproof (one couple I met with a room facing the street had noise issues). I would recommend this hotel. The espresso machine is a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Anniversary Break”
Reviews.Author: Calamine77
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Chic and Basic for our first wedding anniversary. They could not have been more accommodating - when we arrived it was pouring with rain, so when we checked in (early and not a problem) he noticed our room smelt of sewage (just dodgy Spanish drains I think!), so the manager called our room and offered to move us. We accepted and were moved to a room at the front of the hotel with a balcony and some beautiful original features etc. The rooms are not huge, we booked a large and it was ample, but as the building is so old, I imagine every room differs somewhat (we saw 2 and they were similar sizes but very different shapes). The lighting is a real feature and a novelty! The bathroom and shower are really original too. Beds really firm (we both have bad backs!) There is a free safe you can use and the free refreshments are brilliant. Excellent location, literally 3 minutes from the Born area and all other areas lead off that too. We ended up eating and drinking in the Born area as it was more our style (little funky boutiques, jewellery shops, bars, cafes, restaurants) and very local. We ate in various places and would highly recommend each - Bilbao Barras - fab relaxed Tapas help yourself to as much as you want - great for lunch ( a bit smoky - there is no ban in Spain!). "Cheese Me" - if you love cheese and wine, you will love this! Then a lovely Tapas restaurant with loads of vegetarian options - cannot remember the name, but on the street behind Santa Maria church, down from the Gaudi Museum and opposite a Tea shop (it's black and white and modern looking). Excellent service, brilliant english, fresh, well made food. We loved all the wine shops that were also cafes too as well as the Chocolate and Churros!!! Barcelona is an exhausting city but there are so many places to sit and chill as well we loved it! The only down sides for us were the weather and the fact we flew with Ryan air who fly into Gerona, not Barcelona - although the bus system is VERY well organised, it cuts into your time there (1 hr 15 on bus). Overall Chic and Basic is V reasonable for the location, service, style, facilities and we would definately return. The White Bar (part of the hotel) says it is a cocktail bar as well as restaurant, it isn't - but looked good if you dont want to walk anywhere. We booked direct with the hotel as none of the discount sites had rooms avail and it cost us £270 for 2 nights in a Large room.

Reviews.Title: “More than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ChillAPadi
Reviews.Content: When I booked this place, I did not have that high expectations, considering I paid 96 euros for the M room. So I kind of expected a 1) small room (since I booked the smallest room) 2) overdone led lights 3) no service. In fact my experience was the complete opposite. The room is a comfortable size for one person. It has a double bed, door to the courtyard which lets sunlight in. The room is very well designed. It had everything I needed. Clean uncluttered space, fantastic flat screen interactive TV - reminds me of the Singapore Airline interactive TV. The led lights were in fact quite fun to play around with - set different moods with the different lights. The service is friendly. Internet is FREE. Coffee, tea and the most essential water which seems to be sorely lacking even in more expensive hotels in Barcelona is in abundance - just help yourself in the self service area. The neighbourhood is absolutely great. If you like the alternative type neighbourhood - with the best small shops and cafes/ restauraunts nearby, and the Metro about 10 mins walk away. I completely loved my stay there and I will be recommending to all my friends without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Funky”
Reviews.Author: CClarke74
Reviews.Content: The rooms are exactly as they appear on the website. The decor is minimalist and white. The rooms themselves are compact, not much room between the door and the huge bed, but it's all about basic too - nothing fussy here. There is a multi media screen (don't call it a telly - so says the guide book) in the room behind another screen of beads. You get a cool welcome pack with some useful information and some goodies which I loved. There is a screen of beads separating the room and the spacious bathroom, you can peer through the beads straight into the large glass shower - lots of fun. The room doesn't have a mini bar, but there is an area where you can lounge on funky chairs, drink coffee or tea and help yourself to a bar of alcoholic beverages and chocolate. The location of the hotel is great, very close to the Old Town and lots of bars and restaurants and easy walking distance to the harbour and the park. We enjoyed our stay and definitely recommend it for couple wanting something a bit different.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: nisseOslo
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel, We liked it. Had a XL large room with balcony. Perfect location, good and safe neighborhood. With very good bars and restaurants. Gracia's.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but not basic!”
Reviews.Author: foxy343
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from staying at Chic & Basic Born for 3 nights and had a great time. It was a great base for our weekend and good value. The hotel was in a great location for walking to all the sites (only used public transport to get to Park Guell, we walked everywhere else) and going out at night - there is a fab choice of restaurants and bars in the area round the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but it looked popular (with non-hotel guests too) while we were there having drinks. We booked an XL room and it was huge, with a massive and very comfortable bed. We were in room 1 which didn't have a balcony but did have a number of funky skylights - so we could lay in bed and look at the sky (they do have shutters so you can sleep late in the morning!) :) The help yourself lounge area was a great idea, with free tea, coffee and bottled water whenever you want. We loved the whole decor and style of the hotel and rooms, with coloured lighting, white walls, interesting furniture and transparent shower cubicle on the edge of the room. The welcome pack waiting for us in our room was a nice touch, telling you all about the hotel plus sweets, complimentary shower gel and soap. Hotel staff on reception were always friendly and helpful and they were happy to store our bags for as long as we wanted on our last day as our flight wasn't till late evening and check out was midday.

Reviews.Title: “A Great and Unique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: JAFA79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early March 2008 with my fiance. We booked directly with the hotel and booked an XL room (only one available at time of booking). A friend had previously stayed in a large room and found this more than adequate so if price is an issue, there's probably no need for an XL room. The hotel is really unique. The only staff you'll see are one receptionist and occasonnaly a cleaner, so it's really light touch in that regard, which I loved. The building itself has a real depth of history and they manage to combine this really well with the stark whiteness of the rooms and the funky decor and lighting, it did look a bit tired in areas (window frames needing a lick of paint) but this didn't detract from the whole experience. The help yourself bar of coffee and bottled water and vending machines of other drinks including alcohol were great. All this coupled with a really good location in the Born district made for a perfect weekend visit. The only off thing was outside the hotel where there was a really funny sulphuric type smell, but don't worry this didn't permeate inside. I would probably suggest that this is not really a hotel for older people or families. Whilst I could be wrong on this, I simply say it as i can't imagine my mum and dad getting it at all. Go stay here, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Basic - perfect name for this good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dizzydi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended up staying at this hotel because the place we were originally staying at mixed up our booking. They booked the Chic and Basic for us for 2 nights. We really didn't know what to expect! When we arrived and checked into our room we were more than happy. We'd never stayed at a hotel quite like it! The decor is white, with coloured lighting and curtain type things made up of individual crystal effect strands - these are in the corridors and bedrooms and give a great effect. Our room was the M type (120 Euros per night), which was fine - really comfy queensize bed and a big shower enclosure in the middle of the room, with one of the crystal curtains around it (which you could pull around the clear enclosure, or not!). You get shower gel, robe/slippers and mineral water. There was also a TV. One of the things I loved about the room was being able to change the lighting from blue, to green or red. The only thing we didn't like about the room was that it didn't have an opening window - just a frosted glass window with a blind that seemed to overlook a narrow internal courtyard. Some of the other types of rooms do have an opening window or balcony. The location is excellent - the Born area has loads of great bars and restaurants, there are a couple of metro stops nearby (Jaume I the nearest I think) and its not too far to wander over to the Barri Gotic or las Ramblas. We didn't have breakfast in the bar/restaurant, The White Room, but we did have a drink in there. Really nice cocktails and good atmosphere. The 'Common Zone' was great - free tea, coffee and mineral water, sofas for lounging on, free internet and a vending machine with beer and chocolate. We would stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for something a bit different and in a great area of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Pretending to be a local!”
Reviews.Author: ColMc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chic and Basic Princessa apartments on Princessa st. for about a week in May 2007. We had a large two bedroom apartment though there were just two of us. Perfect location in El Born (the best area in Barcelona). The apartment had two (small) balconies and old wooden double doors onto them. Great way to pretend like you live there! The price was very reasonable too! Only down side was the wall between bedrooms was a partition, didn't bother us, but perhaps not ideal for two couples.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed in yet!”
Reviews.Author: SunSeaSangria2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4nights, we booked an XL large room and our stay was fantastic. The staff are extremly helpful, the hotel itself is unique, with the shower actually in your room! and loved the added message logos on everything, also having the 'break out' area where you could help yourself to refreshments for free was great and very hard to come by in most hotels and having the balcony was an added bonus. Great location as your right on top of the born district with great bars and restaurants. We would recommend this hotel in heartbeat and are currently looking into staying again this october and can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyKate
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for 3 nights. We had an XL room, which didn't disappoint. It had a comfortable queensize bed, flat screen TV, balcony, hanging rail, and a couple of drawers for storage as well as a hairdryer - so girls, no need to take one with you. The shower in the middle of the room is a great novelty, as is the different coloured lighting The lounge offers free interent access and free tea, coffee and bottles of water. The room didn't have a mini bar/fridge or safe, but this was no big deal. The hotel is in a great location. It's literally about 10min walk from the train station 'Estacion de Franca'. It's far enough out of the chaos of Las Ramblas, but a close enough easy walk into the centre (about 10mins). It's also a few mins walk to both the chocolate museum and the Picasso museum. My boyfriend chose this hotel for our stay and i can say i was most pleasantly suprised. It is a clean, modern, unique place to stay in a great area - definitely not fuddy duddy!! Would stay here again, if visiting the city again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KentLucy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my boyfriend and it was amazing! It was for his bday so i wanted it to be special and i wasnt let down at all! request a balcony as these rooms are huge (and great value) and you get a stunning view of the Cathedral near by The hotel is in the gothic quarter so you wak out of the hotel and are near loads of restaurants and can walk to La Ramblas and the port area etc the Chromotherapy was amazing! what an experience i would go back tomorrow Tip-try the cool bar next door that is part of the hotel-FAB cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Super fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: orion_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family at the end of December and had a great time. Don't expect fancy soaps or room service, but do expect a truly unique hotel setting and friendly employees. The cute slogans they have printed everywhere are just icing on the cake, as are the groovy neon lights and the superb location within the Born neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “***Great Hotel***”
Reviews.Author: FionaPat
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel and great location. The staff were excellent and very helpful. An amazing tapas bar just around the corner called Santa Maria! Great for couples - 100% will stay here the next time I visit Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice design Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Julie77
Reviews.Content: I had a very good time at the Chic and Basic Born hotel. Very good situation in Barcelona. My room was in the second floor and it was not noisy at all. Confortable bed, nice shower. The young lady at the reception could have been more friendly, she did not seem very happy to work but it's O.K. I would stay there again as I think it is a nice hotel not so expensive for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jane0166
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Chic & Basic Born from Aug 26th to the 29th. We purchased the extra-large room with a balcony on Expedia. They gave us room #1. It did not have a balcony (they told us not all of the rooms have them even though I had emailed them before we left verifying that we got a balcony). The strange thing is that it didn't have any windows at all, which made it really claustrophobic! It had 2 windows that when you opened them, you looked out on an old elevator shoot. That must be how the roach got in the room! It had some cool skylights though in the ceiling. The problem with that is that they had a sky light directly above the shower. As I took a shower, I looked up into the blue sky and a man on the 4th floor of the next building who was looking down watching me take a shower! I couldn't believe it. He even had to put his hand up to block the sun's glare a few times. This made me mad. Needless to say, we asked to be moved and told them about the guy on the roof. No apologies, but the next day we got a room with a balcony. The bad thing here is that we couldn't sleep the next few nights because of all the street noise. (We were on the street with all the large garage bins and a yappy dog who barked constantly. There must be a dozen different trash companies, because they came at different times one morning to get the trash). We won't be staying here again. It was a disappointment! The good things included the location, the air conditioning the cool lights & the free water.

Reviews.Title: “Anyone Young: Oh so Cool you Gotta Go”
Reviews.Author: friendlydentist
Reviews.Content: Ok I am 24 my husband 34 and he is a dentist for a little fyi. We travel the world and try to stay at the nicest yet hippest places at the places we go. Chic was unbelievable the staff was so nice, all young so they were all understanding and helpful. Now for all honesty the rooms are basic with very basic amenities, but the bag and the presentation makes up for it, hilarious really! But I mean who now a days does not take shampoo soap etc.. But the bed was comfy the shower was so unique I just loved it. I mean to put it in the middle of the floor surrounded in glass with the beads hanging down and the lights below it at night so neat. The common area was nice, computer to use, free espresso, free water, and vending machine with beer! Also the bar was really great you gotta try the Sex in Barcelona so delish, and I do not like fruity drinks. But the best was the location in walking distance to everything worth seeing, the Born district is super hip with great restaurants and shopping, we know it is pricey and you can go to other parts of Barcelona to shop for much cheaper but oh well! Loved it, if we ever go back to Barcelona before having kids we will for sure stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “You've just got to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: AudnAde
Reviews.Content: Booked this after reading reviews, and it has been one of the most magical experiences! Spent a bit more and had a larger room, but well worth the extra. It's all just so different - massive and very comfortable bed, fantastic ambience, computer linked plasma screen TV, very clean, perfect aircon, not noisy, helpful staff, and what a fantastic White Bar - best Mojitos outside of Cuba! OK so the breakfast is fairly simple, but reasonably varied, and lots of it, and so relaxing with the newspapers. But best of all is the location - right in the Born district, which buzzes with bars, cafes & restaurants within a very short walk (sit & watch the very chic world go by in the Placa de Santa Maria, or try the jazz bars on Carrer de la Princesa), and Las Ramblas and the Barri Gotic are only a 10 minute walk away. Also, it's only 3 minutes walk to the old mainline station (Estacio de Franca), which has direct trains to the airport every half hour. We felt it to be a very safe area at night (as long as you avoid some of the tiny back alleys nearer Las Ramblas), and very clean. We fell in love with Barcelona, and will certainly be back at the Chic & Basic (half right, it is very chic, but hardly basic ! )

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: easytravelller
Reviews.Content: We are a female couple (23 and 25 years old) who were travelling for the first time to Barcelona. We went for four days and I was hesitant to book Chic&Basic Born because some reviews commented on the noise - Wasn't a problem at all. Staff were friendly and helpful, we were upgraded to a large room for no reason (lovely surprise!) and we thought the coloured lights were fun and a bit different. We were both EXTREMELY HAPPY with the hotel and it's well worth the money. Good for young/young at heart couples, prob not someone you don't mind seeing you naked in the shower. But highly highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Funky and basic”
Reviews.Author: travelbug57
Reviews.Content: It was definitely a bit more classy than what lots of reviews said. It was very funky in its decor and understated. The noise levels were a bit much on some nights. On our first night our toilet started running and the front desk person said no one could do anything until morning. Well next morning apparently a neighbors room had started to leak! We were awoken by loud clanking of repairmen. We were switched to a nicer room however, and they were very apologetic. The location is terrific, right in the heart of the born district. I would NEVER go back in July, seeing as the streets are so old and narrow and the wave of tourists is overwhelming..but our first 2 nights (mid-week) were nice and walking around was tolerable. Overall, nice hotel, comfortable room and nice staff. Not recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: jel79
