Reviews.Content: Spacious apartment set in a little street just off Princesa Street. The apartment is ideal for those wanting a quiet nights sleep, without excessive street noise (eg a family). The apartments are close to major attractions including the Picasso Museum, Santa maria cathedral, Barri Gotic, Las Ramblas, Arc De Triomph, Zoo and the harbour. The apartment itself was clean, tidy and had everything we could ever need for our stay. The apartments are fully air conditioned - a must for a summer visit! The company letting the apartments is professional, the building secure and the process of booking simple. Commuication prior to and after your stay is excellent. The only thing we were left confused and disappointed with was the checkout process. We were told we would be met at 11am, but were left standing in the foyer waiting for almost 30 minutes. The building maintenace guy wasnt able to speak english, and we couldnt understand him. Luckily, a person speaking both languages arrived and was able to explain that the keys should have been left on the dining table... This could have been outlined in the information pack they provide in the apartment. Overall great value for money, and in a fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-ultra cool!”
Reviews.Author: theproclaimers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading and about new and up and coming hotels in Barcelona in an English newspaper. This hotel certainly is all that it is cracked up to be and more. What makes it stand out is its style and attention to detail with its mood changing lights troughout the hotel and your room (these are fantastic-we are easily seduced!), the help yourself fridge and coffee machine. There is also free internet access, mini-gym (if you feel that way inclined when you are on your hols!), and the White Bar downstairs serving food, drinks and cocktails. We went for the smallest (cheapest!) room which was fine for us-see the photos-although some may argue they have sacrificed what some travellers may take for granted in other hotels for style and chic eg, the front desk staff were not overly forthcoming with useful information, the white walls showed all the scuff marks that have gathered, and our balcony doors did not look out onto a view that was anything to write home about (and they did not lock which may have bothered travellers more security conscious than us!). But these are minor quibbles and did not stop us from having a fab time at Chic and Basic. Also note it is in a great location, 5 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station and a short walk from the railway station where the Airport train terminates. If we go back to Barcelona we will be sure to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Funky & comfy”
Reviews.Author: Kate2207
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in June and thought Chic & basic was a fab hotel. The lighting system is great fun and the bed was so comfortable we didn't want to get out. The street outside our room was quite noisy but closing the balcony doors and using the air-con (unusually efficient for a hotel) solved that problem. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is only a short walk to the centre and there are plenty of bars and restaurants in Born itself. It was also only a 5 min walk to the train station - very handy for getting to and from the airport. I wouldn't recommend booking anything smaller than a large room though. There were a couple of things missing like a safe and drinks making facilities in the room but these are free in the lounge area. This is a hotel for a young couple looking for something different to your average hotel but on a budget and who are not shy about showering in front of each other.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: milajayne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well above our expectations. Our room was gorgeous, with 'mood music', 'mood lighting' and a lovely white leather love nest built into the balcony. It was very cool and definitely aimed at romantic couples. There is a small gym and little areas where you can sit around the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel. Nearest stop is Jaume metro, with the airport train stopping very close by as well (5 minute walk). The area itself El Born is very up and coming and obviously the trendy place to be, with some very cool clothes shops. The hotel is also 5 minutes walk away from La Citadella Park which is lovely to laze around and go boating on the small lake. Its also about 20 minutes walk to the beach. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave'n'Rach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a long weekend in May. We arrived late from Girona airport and fortunately the hotel is only a short walk from the bus station. The staff working in reception were very helpful and provided us with a welcome pack. The room was very open and funky with lots of gadgets. Would recommend to people wanting to stay in a central location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there! It's a youth hostel!”
Reviews.Author: MetrogirlSTHLM
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed for one night and this hotel. We had looked at their web sight and booked a suite. It looked very stylish but lacked everything when it comes to function. It was impossibel to get any sleep at all due to thin walls (could hear the cuple next door talking), a building designed lika an amplifier and people closing and opening doors thru the whole night. There were very posh windows in the ceiling and guess what happened and 6 o'clock in the morning? the whole room lights up as the sun comes up. Impossible to sleep! I would only recomed this hotel to someone who wants to have so many drinks that they become unconscius. There were stains on the bath room floor and towels big like stamps, one of them broken. A youth hostel would have more exeprienced and more helpful staff. A great suggestion is to get off the phone when hotel guests come into the lobby. It doesnt cost anything to be polight.
